intro: Anil cryptantha, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bract structures. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Anil cryptantha is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep root systems and reduced leaf surfaces. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
